ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Trade skills for foragers
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Fish rolls are trivial at 135. :-) ... I have found a very easy way to advance pottery. make small bowls til trivial at about 102 or so. Don t even bother
ygData.messageBody:
> Baking is easy to advance if you forage. Fish rolls. Hunt a stack of
> bat wings, fish a mess of fish. Combine in oven, one and one. The
> level to trivial is around 100.
>
Fish rolls are trivial at 135. :-)
>
> Haven't found a quick and easy way to advance pottery, yet. Tailoring
> has been my primary skill, advancing with my main experience as I
> made my own armor. Hope one day to make Misty armor.
>
I have found a very easy way to advance pottery. make small bowls til
trivial at about 102 or so. Don't even bother to use the kiln. just make
unfinished pots on the wheel and ditch them. the price it costs for the
metal sheet to fire is the same price you get paid to sell the bowl. it's
not worth the time.
Tailoring has been a thorn in my side. Had a hard time finding supplies.
Just have bad luck. heh.
And did you see some of the new armor quests now? I'm miffed that the bard
armor quest is only for humans and half-elves.
luv,
-Su
